articles.title: Apple Card named Best Co-Branded Credit Card for Customer Satisfaction with No Annual Fee by J.D. Power
articles.summary: Apple Card, issued by Goldman Sachs, has been recognized for the third consecutive year as the Best Co-Branded Credit Card for Customer Satisfaction with No Annual Fee by J.D. Power. This award highlights Apple Card's commitment to user financial health, including features like Daily Cash rewards and the recently launched Savings account, which has accumulated over $10 billion in deposits. Apple and Goldman Sachs continue to collaborate on expanding the value and benefits offered to Apple Card users.

articles.title: Hedge fund exposure to 7 biggest tech stocks at record high, Goldman Sachs says
articles.summary: Hedge funds have reached record exposure to the seven largest tech stocks by market capitalization, according to Goldman Sachs data, driven by strong performance and the artificial intelligence theme. These seven stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, now constitute about 20% of the total net market value held by hedge funds tracked by Goldman Sachs. Despite the concentration risk, investment managers rationalize these allocations due to the significant returns generated by these companies this year.

articles.title: The best ETFs for retirement income
articles.summary: This article explores the best ETFs for retirement income, focusing on conservative asset allocation ETFs and tactical overlays for retirees. It discusses how these ETFs can help reduce volatility, hedge inflation, and generate income, with insights from financial experts on their suitability for different risk tolerances and financial situations. The author also delves into defensive sector ETFs and low-volatility ETFs as additional strategies for Canadian retirees.

articles.title: 'Not just money and math': Young people are willing to sacrifice returns for ESG
articles.summary: New data reveals that young investors are increasingly willing to sacrifice investment returns to align their portfolios with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) causes they care about. This trend is particularly strong among Gen Z and millennials, with many prepared to underperform market averages for values-aligned investments. Behavioral scientists suggest this reflects a need for young people to signal their values and identity through their investment choices.

articles.title: Dropbox review: Still the best at syncing and sharing
articles.summary: This PCWorld review reaffirms Dropbox's position as a top choice for fast, reliable file synchronization and sharing, despite its limited free storage and lack of intermediate subscription tiers. While it excels in its core functionality and offers business-oriented features, its pricing model lacks options between the free 2GB and the paid 2TB. The article highlights its strengths for collaborative file access and its backup capabilities.
